result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan K Otters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Credit For Time Served 1 Day.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid to Kohl's as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain/Obtain full time school or employment.
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.
No contact with Kohl's during Probation.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Megan K Otters in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State will offer the retail theft be changed to a misdemeanor but an amended information is not yet drafted.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Rider makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.   

The Court Orders the Following:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
30 Days Huber (Credit - 1 day) HUBER WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.

Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Maintain/Obtain full time school or employment;
No contact with Kohls during probation.
Restitution: $286.00 to Kohls to be paid as a condition of probation.  
Costs: $ 253.00 as a condition of probation
